section.section: The power granted in paragraph (2) of this subsection is in addition to powers conferred on the authority by this subtitle and does not limit any power of the authority under this subtitle.
Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the authority may authorize the executive director to take any of the actions described in paragraph (2) of this subsection.

If the authority authorizes the executive director to take any of the actions described in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the authority shall prescribe limits within which the executive director may exercise discretion.

text.section: An authority may issue the bonds at one time or in one or more series from time to time.
Subject to any provisions for their registration, bonds are negotiable instruments for all purposes regardless of whether they are payable from a special fund.

section.section:
The bonds may be:
Serial bonds;
Term bonds; or
Both in the discretion of the authority.
The bonds shall mature within a period not to exceed 50 years after the date of issue.
The bonds shall be payable in United States currency.
An authority shall sell the bonds at competitive or negotiated sale in a manner and for a price the authority determines to be in the authority's best interests.
Bonds are exempt from §§ 8-206 and 8-208 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

text.section: An officer's signature or facsimile on a bond remains valid even if the officer leaves office before the bond is delivered.
Pending preparation of the definitive bonds, an authority may issue interim receipts or certificates that will be exchanged for definitive bonds.

section.section: A trust agreement authorizing bonds may contain provisions that are part of the contract with the bondholders.

text.section: The members of an authority and a person executing the bonds may not be held liable personally on the bonds.
